required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a common inflammatory demyelinating disorder of the central nervous system frequently affecting females in their reproductive phase of life. In this prospective observational study, we obtain data on the outcome of pregnancies in MS patients and the influence of pregnancy on clinical, laboratory and MRI parameters in MS.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Time (in days) until relapse during the observation period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Number of T2 lesions in spinal and cerebral magnetic resonance imaging

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Number of gadolinium enhancing lesions in spinal and cerebral magnetic resonance imaging

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of T2 lesions in spinal and cerebral magnetic resonance imaging

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of gadolinium enhancing lesions in spinal and cerebral magnetic resonance imaging

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in immune cell phenotypes of peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in serum galectin-1 concentration measured by ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in serum galectin-3 concentration measured by ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in serum galectin-9 concentration measured by ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in neurofilament serum concentration by using Simoa NfL assay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in interleukin-17 serum concentration assessed by ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in anti-inflammatory interleukin-10 serum concentration assessed by ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Identification and quantification of autoantibodies by using protein microarray and ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Composition of fecal microbiome measured by 16S Sequencing

secondary_outcome.measure: Thickness of the retinal nerve fibre layer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery (compared to baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Thickness of the retinal nerve fibre layer by Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Total macular volume by Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mini-International Neuropsychiatric Interview (M.I.N.I.) German Version 5.0.0 Module A-C
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Structured diagnostic interview to assess depression, dysthymia and suicidality

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Rating of ten depression related symptoms on a scale from 0 to 6 (higher numbers indicate more severe symptoms)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Rating of 21 depression related symptoms on a scale from 0 to 3 (higher numbers indicate more severe symptoms)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report survey containing 10 items, each item is rated 0-3 (higher scores indicate a higher probability of postpartum depression)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report survey containing 21 items, each item is rated 0-4 (higher scores indicate a greater impact of fatigue on a person's activities)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: A self-report survey consisting of 11 items, each item ranges from 1 to 7 (higher scores indicate higher levels of fatigue)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: A self-administered, single scale indication measuring visual fatigue, ranging from 0 to 100 (higher scores indicate worse fatigue)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months after delivery compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: A self-report survey measuring health in eight dimensions (higher scores indicate less disability)

arm_group.description: Patients with clinically isolated syndrome, relapsing-remitting or progressive multiple sclerosis

study_pop.textblock: Patients will be recruted at neurological outpatient clinics and neurological clinics of the Charité and neurologists' medical practices.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age > 18 years
- signed informed consent
- diagnosis of multiple sclerosis or clinically isolated syndrome
Exclusion Criteria:
- clinically relevant comorbidities
- contraindications for MRI, e.g. pacemaker, metal implants, allergy against gadolinium
- alcohol or drug abuse

overall_official.affiliation: Experimental & Clinical Research Unit, Charité Universitätsmedizin Berlin

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results of reported articles (text, tables, figures, supplemental data) will be shared after deidentification
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal
